text: Now, I will grant you, there’s nothing in that column that directly contradicts his plea to air mass execution footage ... but it is notable that his arguments then were directed at the murderers rather than the journalists
author: gabrielsnyder

text: In fact what he wrote at the time was a condemnation of Foley’s murderers and a message to terrorists that viral horror is not effective
author: gabrielsnyder

text: Here’s the blaring inanity of his argument: there was no one who found the fact that news networks didn’t air the video of James Foley’s beheading condemnable, including @jackshafer
author: gabrielsnyder

text: The argument that journalists have been weak-kneed, or whatever dominance-based ad hominem, by being reluctant to spread the Christchurch shooter video is so inane and hottest-of-hot-takes that I feel like I’m taking troll bait just tweeting about it
author: gabrielsnyder

text: ... @jackshafer’s knee-scold version of media criticism managed to stay with tonight
author: gabrielsnyder

text: You know, like a lot people, I read a lot of the stuff on the Internet that makes me mad. But it is very rare for me to stay mad at someone’s hot take for long enough to, say... go grocery shopping, put the kids to bed, talk to my wife about our days, and cook dinner. And yet...
author: gabrielsnyder

text: ... I am glad to be generally aware of what insane thing Trump’s been tweeting but to say that it is “Top News” or even “Most Popular” is way too much.
author: gabrielsnyder

text: I love ⁦@feedly⁩ but this is everything wrong with news driven by social media algorithms...

text: This is the crucial math problem behind Apple's offer to news publishers. text: not a test as in will he or won't he... more of an opportunity to document him committing a crime. if Ken Starr had the "perjury trap," this would be a "pardon trap." ... I should probably go dig out of this rabbit hole I've dug for myself ...
author: gabrielsnyder

text: it looks like Trump's previous pardons specified the criminal convictions they were undoing, so the answer appears to be that, no, presidential pardons are not typically blanket all-your-sins-are-forgiven sorts of things
author: gabrielsnyder

text: At risk of going down the rabbit hole... I wonder if Mueller was testing to see if Trump would pardon Manafort on the financial and lobbying crimes as part of building obstruction of justice and/or RICO charges
author: gabrielsnyder

text: Could Mueller indict Manafort on fresh charges after a Trump pardon? Or does a pardon cover any and all crimes the recipient has ever committed?
